intro: Chassalia ischnophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf chassalia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are a distinguishing feature, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
